bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Short-Term Rental Accommodations Act;
float home means a structure that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: designed, constructed or manufactured to float on water,
used or intended to be used as living accommodation in a fixed location, and
not capable of movement under its own power;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: home exchange means a reciprocal arrangement for a person who offers a right to use the person's property for accommodation in British Columbia in exchange for the right to use another person's property;
outdoor recreational activity has the same definition as in section 8 (2) of the Prescribed Classes of Property Regulation;
strata-titled hotel or motel means a property in which accommodation is provided in a manner similar to that of a hotel or motel and, in respect of which property,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a strata plan is filed under the Strata Property Act, and
different owners own different strata lots;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: student accommodation means property that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ordinarily used for more than 6 months in the calendar year for the living accommodation of students or employees of an educational institution, and
owned or operated by the educational institution or by a non-profit organization;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: time share property means property within British Columbia, other than a property described in section 4 (b) or (c), in respect of which a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has a time share contract within the meaning of the Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act, or
has a time share interest within the meaning of the Real Estate Development Marketing Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this regulation, common property, strata corporation and strata lot have the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the Strata Property Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 1 of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the definition of "exempt land", the geographic areas listed or described in Schedule 1 are prescribed,
in respect of the definition of "platform service", a platform service provided in respect of the following is not a platform service:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided by an operator of outdoor recreational activities,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of the definition of "residence", a float home is a prescribed dwelling, and
in respect of the definition of "short-term rental accommodation service", an accommodation service is prescribed if, when the accommodation service was first provided,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: accommodation was to be provided for 90 consecutive days or more but ends before 90 consecutive days have passed, and
the end of the accommodation could not have been reasonably foreseen by a supplier host.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 3 [what this Act does not apply to] of the Act, a strata-titled hotel or motel is not a hotel or motel.
This Act does not apply to the following properties:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a vehicle;
a tent or other temporary shelter.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The principal residence requirement does not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following properties or circumstances:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: accommodation for visitors of residents of strata lots that is provided primarily in the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a strata lot owned by the applicable strata corporation;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: accommodation that is provided by an operator of outdoor recreational activities;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a strata-titled hotel or motel, in respect of strata lots in which accommodation is provided in a manner similar to that of a hotel or motel, if a property host may not use the property host's property in the strata-titled hotel or motel as a principal residence due to mandatory provisions in the applicable rental pool or rental management agreement;

a property in respect of which a property host holds a fractional interest if the property host may not use the property as a principal residence due to mandatory provisions in the applicable fractional ownership agreement.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Interpretation Relating to Principal Residence Requirement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, parcel has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Land Title Act.

For the purposes of section 14 (1) (b) [principal residence requirement] of the Act, in respect of an accessory dwelling unit referred to in that paragraph, a prescribed location is on the same parcel as the property host's principal residence.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: eligible vacancy rate means a rental vacancy rate of 3% or more during each of the 2 consecutive years immediately preceding the reference date in relation to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the relevant area, or
another geographic area that includes the relevant area;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: large municipality means a municipality that is listed in Schedule 2;
neighbouring, in respect of a municipality, means the municipality is within 15 kilometres of another municipality;
prescribed date means the date prescribed under section 11 (1) (a) [prescribed date and period of time];
reference date, in respect of a request made under section 15 [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act, means the applicable prescribed date on or before which the request is made;
relevant area, in respect of a municipality or regional district, means the geographic area of the municipality or regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 15 (1) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act, the following criteria are prescribed for a local government that wishes to request that the exempt land be changed in respect of the relevant area:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the local government wishes to request that the principal residence requirement apply and the relevant area be removed from the exempt land,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the local government is a municipality that is listed in paragraph (a) or (b) of Schedule 1 of this regulation, or
the local government is a regional district and the request is made in respect of one or more of the electoral areas of the regional district;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the local government wishes to request that the principal residence requirement not apply and the relevant area be added to the exempt land,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the local government is a large municipality with the eligible vacancy rate, or
the local government is a municipality

bcl:clause.bcl:text: that is listed in Schedule 3 of this regulation, and
that has a neighbouring large municipality with the eligible vacancy rate.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 15 (3) (d) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act, the following persons or entities are prescribed for requests about the geographic areas relevant to each of the persons or entities, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a local trust committee, as defined in section 1 of the Islands Trust Act;
the Cultus Lake Park Board within the meaning of the Cultus Lake Park Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedures for requests by persons or entities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person or entity prescribed under section 8 may request a change to the exempt land in the same manner as a request made by a local government under section 15 (1) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act.
A request made under subsection (1) must be made on or before the prescribed date.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Restriction on requests to remove geographic area from exempt land

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A request made by a local government under section 15 (1) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act to remove a geographic area from the exempt land may not include a request to exempt the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a geographic area listed or described in paragraphs (c) to (h) of Schedule 1 of this regulation;
Cultus Lake Park within the meaning of the Cultus Lake Park Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to Bowen Island Municipality in respect of a geographic area described in paragraph (g) of Schedule 1 of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prescribed date and period of time

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 15 (2) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the prescribed date is March 31 of each year, and
the prescribed period of time is a period of time that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: starts on November 1 of the calendar year of the reference date, and

bcl:clause.bcl:text: if an end date is provided in the regulation that changes the exempt land, that end date;
if no end date is provided as described in clause (A), the date that the exempt land is subsequently changed to remove or add the geographic area that was the subject of the request.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1) (a) and (b) (i), if a request made under section 15 (1) of the Act relates to adding a geographic area to the exempt land in the year 2024,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the prescribed date is February 29, 2024, and
the prescribed period of time starts on May 1, 2024.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Factors for Lieutenant Governor in Council to consider
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 15 (3) (e) [requests for changes to exempt land] of the Act, the following factors are prescribed in the case of a request made by a municipality to be added to the exempt land:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the rental vacancy rate in relation to the relevant area or another geographic area that includes the relevant area;
the manner by which the rental vacancy rate was determined.
